required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Premedication Protocols for Neonatal Endotracheal Intubation on Cerebral Oxygenation
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Two Different Premedication Protocols for Endotracheal Intubation in Neonates on Cerebral Oxygenation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the influence of premedication drugs Atropin, Fentanyl and Mivacurium and of endotracheal intubation on cerebral oxygenation and cardiac output in term and preterm newborn infants. Two different protocols of premedication are compared.

detailed_description.textblock:
Influence of the following procedures will be examined:
- Application of Atropin
- Application of Fentanyl
- Application of Mivacurium
- possible desaturation and / or bradycardia during intubation attempts
- restoration of arterial oxygen saturation and / or heart rate after succesful intubation
We aim to examine the change of the following parameters by the use of electrical cardiometry:
- stroke volume
- cardiac output
We compare two different premedication protocols and we evaluate the impact of these protocol on the time needed for intubation and on intubation difficulties .

primary_outcome.measure: Change of cerebral tissue oxygen saturation during premedication and intubation
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 minute before first study drug until 10 minutes after end of procedure
primary_outcome.description: A baseline value of cerebral tissue oxygen saturation before first application of premedication drugs is determined. Change of cerebral tissue oxygen saturation is defined as area under this threshold from first drug application until recovery.

arm_group.description: Give Atropin, then Mivacurium, immediately followed by Fentanyl
Give atropin, then Fentanyl, then Mivacurium

intervention.description: Atropin 10µg/kg Mivacurium 200µg/kg immediately followed by Fentanyl 2µg/kg
Atropin 10µg/kg Fentanyl 2µg/kg, repeat max. two times Mivacurium 200µg/kg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- newborn infant below 44 weeks postmenstrual age
- indication for elective or semi-elective endotracheal Intubation
- parental informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- emergency intubation
